medical_history.chief_complaint: Pain in the left inguinal region.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had a 10-year history of inguinal hernias, with intermittent bulging. Pain associated with the bulging increased approximately 3 months prior to presentation. Over the last 3 weeks, the hernia on the left side enlarged and the patient noted intermittent subjective fevers and night sweats. One week before presentation, he felt 'hard lumps' next to the hernia that were tender on palpation. The night before presentation, he recorded an oral temperature of 38.1°C.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV infection diagnosed 8 years ago, CD4 count of 66 cells/mm³ at diagnosis, treated for Kaposi’s sarcoma, molluscum contagiosum, anal dysplasia, pulmonary Mycobacterium avium complex infection, pneumocystis pneumonia, thrush, preseptal cellulitis, and diarrhea caused by cryptosporidium. History of transiently elevated liver function tests attributed to fatty liver or alcoholic liver disease.
medical_history.family_history: Father had coronary artery disease; mother had fibromyalgia; siblings and adult children reported as healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Heterosexual, divorced, lived with a female partner who is also HIV-positive. Smoked cigarettes for 30 years, consumed one to two alcoholic beverages daily, no use of illicit drugs, worked in construction. Changed litter for a 22-year-old cat without recalling bites or scratches. Traveled to Oklahoma approximately 6 months prior to presentation.
